items.sentence: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
This job could be a lot tougher than we imagined.
Those who want to join the club should sign here.
Tom and John are double-dating the Jackson twins.
Tom and Mary have adopted a minimalist lifestyle.
She\'d rather be spending time with someone else.
Did you really think I wouldn\'t learn the truth?
Tom thought Mary already knew how to drive a car.
Tom thought he was going to be able to meet Mary.
We haven\'t seen each other for such a long time.
We probably don\'t have enough money to buy that.
Tom said something to Mary that I couldn\'t hear.
I wanted to talk to you because I need your help.
John isn\'t the kind of man who would betray you.
I\'ve met Tom\'s family and they seem to like me.
If we hadn\'t done that, somebody else would\'ve.
I don\'t think that they could understand French.
I don\'t understand the meaning of this sentence.
Tom could smell breakfast cooking in the kitchen.
I began to understand the reason why he hated me.
You\'re not going to like what I\'m about to say.
You\'re the most beautiful bride I\'ve ever seen.
Tom poured a bucket of ice-cold water on himself.
Can you spare me a few minutes? I need your help.
Can you tell us what the bank robber looked like?
It\'s obvious Tom knows what he\'s talking about.
Let\'s get out of here! That\'s going to explode!
The flight was canceled because of the thick fog.
The flowers are for you. The chocolate is for me.
Tom wasn\'t able to catch the ball with one hand.
I don\'t know anybody who thinks Tom can do that.
Tom couldn\'t understand why Mary frowned at him.
Tom did better today than he\'s ever done before.
We\'ve been waiting for hours for you to show up.
What I\'m about to say will answer your question.
If Tom doesn\'t eat this, please give it to Mary.
I wonder whether or not this is really necessary.
I wonder why Tom has been so nice to me recently.
How many people do you think are in the audience?
Tom says he\'s climbed this mountain three times.
Tom says you don\'t want to go to Boston with us.
There\'s a large clock near the top of the tower.
This garden is open to the public and it\'s free.
My mother often sings when she\'s washing dishes.
Tom was quite a ladies\' man when he was younger.
When I hear that song, I think about my hometown.
Although Tom is sick, he\'s swimming again today.
Why didn\'t you tell us this was going to happen?
Why don\'t you stay here with us for a few weeks?
I don\'t think that I know Tom as well as you do.
